intro: Pabstiella mouraeoides, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
